subject: Communication
title: The Spotlight Effect Illusion
description: Learn The Spotlight Effect Illusion in one minute.

hook.text: You stumble over a word on stage and think everyone noticed. They almost certainly didn't.

buildup.text: The spotlight effect is our tendency to overestimate how much others notice our mistakes.

discovery.text: Cornell researchers had students wear embarrassing shirts. They guessed 50% noticed â€” only 25% did.

twist.text: Audiences are focused on the message, not your flaws. Their attention is far less precise than you fear.

climax.text: Most audience members are thinking about lunch, their phone, or their own anxiety â€” not your mistake.

punchline.text: Nobody is watching you as closely as you think.

quiz.question: What does the spotlight effect describe?
options: Others noticing more than we think
